meanings.sent1: The puppy began to puler when it missed its owner.
meanings.sent2: When the baby woke up, it started to puler for attention.
meanings.sent3: The kitten continued to puler until it was given a warm blanket.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees puler softly in the night.
meanings.sent5: As the sad movie played, the audience could hear some viewers puler quietly.

meanings.definition: A person who whines or complains constantly
meanings.sent1: Don't be a puler and face your challenges bravely.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was disrupted by the constant complaints of the puler.
meanings.sent3: The puler at work always finds something to whine about.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the puler of the group, never satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent5: The child was labeled as a puler by his friends due to his constant whining.
